Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MultiTripper
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at 4am due to a late flight and a long wait at Dubai immigration. Our taxi driver couldnt give us change from a 100AED note (fresh from airport ATM) The cost was 45AED. The friendly night reception staff at the hotel kindly gave us change from their own pockets for the 100. We checked in and were shown to our room which smelt nice and was clean. The bed was very comfortable and it all looked nice and clean. The toilet had a bit of a smell (bad drains?)The bath was narrow but long. the tiles were mouldy and hadnt been fitted well onto the walls. The little kitchen was fantastic - so many cupboards and everything we needed. I took washing up liquid with me and a scrubber and dish cloth. they provided tea towels. The downside of the kitchen for me was the induction hob. I do not know how to cook on this and there were no instructions - I ruined our dinner one night and filled the room with a terrible smell of burning! The rooftop swimming pool was very busy as there were so many families staying there. Not enough sunbeds. The water was lovely - like a warm bath, but as the weather got cooler over the next week then the water was too cold for me to swim. No shelter from the strong wind on the roof. The view was pretty good up there. Wi-fi available in lobby can be very slow as this was a busy hotel. Theres a long couch and a 2 seater couch and 2 chairs for sitting on. There were always people sitting there. The lobby was like a train station with so many people walking past - take away and supermarket delivery men were forever going in and out as well as all the guests. We were supposed to have a newspaper delivered every day but only got one twice. It wasnt a problem as you could pick one up from the reception area. One day we only got one bath towel, another day no toiletries. The room was always cleaned well and I just phoned housekeeping when something had been forgotten. if we didnt leave our room early then the room wouldnt be made up until afternoon. On our last day we went out before 10am and when we went back in at 12 and then 2.30, the bed was stripped,sheets lying on the chair and the bed pulle out from the wall. We wanted to get on with our packing so i had to ask reception if they would get someone to finish the room. It was more than an hour before it was done. We had fallen asleep one night when the doorbell rang. A delivery man was at our door with bags. He insisted we had ordered something as he had the right room. maybe the wrong Winchester hotel!!!!! I was so annoyed - he ruined our sleep. Putting the do not disturb sign on means nothing! A couple of mornings we were woken at 7am with the cleaners chatting very loudly outside. The walls of the rooms are soundproofed but there is noise from the corridors that comes through the door. Some guests were very inconsiderate as they made so much noise on returning to their rooms late at night. For what we paid this hotel was ok, but just ok. We had stayed in the 4 points Downtown Sheraton on previous visits to Dubai which was far classier (and we paid a lot more) though the rooms were on a par. I wouldnt return to Winchester apartments. A taxi from airport to here - night rate - was AED45 and a taxi hailed from the road at hotel to take us back to airport cost us AED25 - also night rate -05.30am

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for that price”
Reviews.Author: jswaminat
Reviews.Content: the apartment is well furnished and spacious. The housekeeping can do a better a job at cleaning and the front desk women should definitely be more customer friendly. The men were very helpful. Stayed there with family of 2 small children and found it very conviniently located. The pool, shuttle were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A laugh”
Reviews.Author: hitesh_depala
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 10nights. The hotel is well located near the metro (5-10min walk) and taxis drive by regular. There also many restaurants near by, so as well so going there or getting a take away is not to bad. The room are of ok standard and clean. The reception service I found it to be very poor and not really approchable. I complained about the hot water not working a few times but the issue was not resloved. The shuttle service they offer is good but would recommend they open up more locations. Over all an Ok and may return if I choose another type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Hotel Apartment”
Reviews.Author: IsaacKerala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Bur Dubai with easy access to most of the places of Dubai. Spinneys & Burjuman shopping mall are nearby. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are huge (considering the money you are paying), fully fitted to a high standard. Fully equipped kitchen, washing machine, microwave, kettle, all utensils and everything for self cooking. Bathroom is very spacious and very good, cleaned daily and towels replaced everyday.Large soft bed and a big sofa in the living room. Dining table and chairs, iron+board, 40" LCD TV in living room and another 32" one in bed room, with all international and local channels. The restaurant is available only for the breakfast. I definitely recommend this hotel for all budget+ travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Look past reception”
Reviews.Author: soulboyBognor
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms,fully fitted to a high standard,with full kitchen and washing machine,microwave,kettle,2 ring hob,all utensils very good.Bathroom very spacious,also very good,cleaned daily,towels replaced every day.Some have mentioned soft bed on here,i loved it myself.Table and chairs to eat at,more comfy chairs to sit in with another table,safe deposit box,iron+board.All in all very good standard room. When you leave the hotel turn right 1minute there is a supermarket so can shop for food there.Turn left short walk the metro station,i used all over town £3 unlimited use metro+buses.This i found to be very good,and i used taxis for short distances after that. Dont use the non metered red taxis in front of hotel,they are expensive and do not offer a better service,proper cabs are cheaper and legally have to run the meter from the time you enter. Now i have stayed in hotels in many different destinations,leaving your key in reception when leaving for the day/evening. When i did this at this hotel i came back in the evening to be met by blank faces and no key. This is my problem with this hotel,they are a little bit strange, so look past the reception because the rooms are really very nice. Another thing booking via good booking agency, you still have to pay 20% local taxes extra, which was in small print but you should bear in mind.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: system_error
Reviews.Content: staff not approachable, not helpful at all. check in was ok, we're booked for 1 night. we said to extend another night. receptionist said ok. we paid for the extended night. we were touring dubai when we get a call that we have to leave because our room is reserved for somebody else!! big hassle, big disappointment. the apartment is ok. but the staff needs to learn how to serve their customers right.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chicago2727
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night and regret it. The hotel wasn't terrible by any means, but it wasn't great as well. The staff at the front desk was rude and not very helpful. I booked directly from their website to take advantage of their offer for a free airport drop-off shuttle, but when I went to use it they expected payment, huge issue.......It is one of the cheapest places to stay in Dubai and there is a reason.

Reviews.Title: “what lousy service”
Reviews.Author: BubblesOtoole
Reviews.Content: Arrived early having been assured by our regular agent they were expecting us and would have the rooms ready. Not only were the rooms not ready they wouldn't be until 2.00pm. Six hours after we arrived. The duty manager was rude and uncaring. Do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: london_ozgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Winchester Hotel Apartments for 4 days in Jan 2012. Having spent 3 weeks travelling around the Gulf it was nice to stay somewhere that had a kitchen and more importantly a washing machine. I arrived around 1:30pm. My room was ready for me and I organised internet for the apartment. If you are staying more than 3 days it is worth getting a weekly internet pass rather than paying daily. As I had a kitchen, I went down to the supermarket and bought items for breakfast rather than having their breakfast. John on reception is very helpful if you need anything. I didnt deal with anyone else. I found the private taxi drivers outside the hotel to be a ripoff. Suggest if you need a taxi, just get a normal one. Outside of that, it was a good stay as long as you remember that this is a 3 star property and dont expect 5 star service. The bed was comfortable, the kitchen serviceable, the bathroom was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Mogamat M
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel just after 2pm and check in is at 2pm,Upon Arrival the staff attitude was very bad,no name tags or a welcome to the Winchester and as if tey doing you 1 huge favour, We were told the room was not ready for check in,and no apology from Duty manager,we were made to wait for an hour with no info given,upon asking about room we were then told it will take another hour,After making noise in the foyer we were given a two bedroom apartment to settle in, we were then told by manager that we can check out later on the day of check out,but on day we were foned by reception that we must check out by 12pm, Also on making the booking we were not told about needed documents, we were 4 adults and 3 kids,we were then asked for passports which we didnt have,fortunately we had our national IDs,and I think what irritated me more was the managers ecxuse was that thi is an arabic country,I was also told at time of making a telphonic booking that I will be emailed with all the info to date I still havent recived an email

Reviews.Title: “Winchester Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: NYCKC
Reviews.Content: The good points are that the rooms are pretty spacious and very clean - I even got upgraded to a suite with a living room and kitchen, the hotel is walking distance to the metro, and there is a grocery store 1 minute away. The bad points are that the room smelled pretty bad and I had to air it out, the front desk staff seemed to be annoyed answering some questions to the point that they seemed to answer things sarcastically as an inside joke to each other. I just picked up a weird vibe there. Also the airport shuttle driver got pretty irate when there was some miscommunication about which terminal to be dropped at. Minor stuff, but still it rubs you the wrong way, they just have to be a bit more professional. Overall not bad, but I wouldn't return or recommend to colleagues going to work in Dubai in the consulting industry.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: SZ_Mac
Reviews.Content: When i was planning my holiday I looked on trip advisor for hotel options that also fit within the budget - Winchester deluxe apartments was rated well - I chose this but was apprehensive as it's classed as a 4 star hotel but in reviews people were saying it's more like a 3 star - well once I got there I arrived at 9am and check in is usually 2pm the staff were extremely helpful and referred me to the pool side whilst they arranged the room for me - I was in my room by 10 am - the cleanliness of the room was good - I usually stay in sofitel hotel chain which is very 1st class however for the price I paid for this hotel I was pleased - it is in a very good location in walking distance of the burjaman centre and also streets full of eateries - I actually spent most nights going to the area to explore and found the food excellent and very reasonably priced - I didn't book any excursions through the hotel as I came across a leaflet for Glt tours who were the most competitive for desert safari, city tour and dhow cruise all for 340dh per person - excellent service from them - thoroughly enjoyed the tours - hotel offers a free shuttle bus to most of the popular destinations which I used a few times on my stay - overall a decent hotel with good rooms - room had kitchen with washer drier - microwave - fridge freezer and cooker - the cleaners were very good even did my washing up if there was anything in the sink! Only problem no wifi in the rooms only in the lobby! No restaurant - but this is not a problem as there are plenty of nice places to eat 5 minute walk away - hope this review helps

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in dubai”
Reviews.Author: JASHFAQ
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights , first night our room was upgraded as when we checked in no rooms were available, but other two nights we got the room that we paid for, hotel rooms were clean . morning reception staff was better than the evening. i had to call room service twice at night for tea and they never showed up, the next day i asked again as they seemed not to care . it is definitely not a walking distance to / from burjuman center, and khalid bin waleed metro station. take a cab to meena bazar, fare is 10 dirhams ( minimum fare within the city ) hotel lobby is always crowded as wifi is only in the lobby , it would be better if they can provide the wifi in room. i will look for other options next time i am visiting dubai

Reviews.Title: “Top Class hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: kassam_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and its was very clean and comfortable to stay in. The staff were very welcoming. The main man is Savio he was awesome. Thank you. [---]

Reviews.Title: “Very Nicely mantained...”
Reviews.Author: amit_sabby
Reviews.Content: i visited this Hotel in January 2011 after lot research on the net, and then visited personally at this Hotel Apartment,dont be confused with its name a like another Hotel apartment near its area only, which i didnt found ok also that one is bit old "Winchester Grand hotel apartment". But this one i found very good so before my family came i booked it in advance. My younger brother ,his wife,my mother,my wife and my daughter were on family holiday so we booked two bedroom apartment.The apartment was very nicely kept clean and managed well with all accesories required for daily needs even small things like needles,iron,locker safe,comb,shaving kit,toothbrush kit...It was having three bathrooms, one king size modren kitchen if any one wanna cook.kitchen topped up with basic crockery/microwave/washing machine and coffee/tea maker. we found the hotel very nicely located in Bur Dubai,easily acessible to all locations thru taxi. the buffet breakfast was very good. We used the roof top pool also.Didnt tried resturant for food as we were always on sight seeing till late night. Only advise we will like to give is there should be atleast once in a day Top up of Coffe/Tea Consumables as per guest numbers,which they denied once it finished on the first day only and deniend topup the next day as there policy. Overall vey good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: takrish
Reviews.Content: First class staff and very customer service oriented.We were there on a stopover and were upgraded to a 3 bedroom unit which was clean, up2date, and comfortable. We were able to get cabs to many places and there is station in walkable distance and grocery next door. I will go back to this hotel if visiting Dubai again. The breakfast was nice too for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ColinHawkes
Reviews.Content: A very good reasonably priced hotel in Bur Dubai, large rooms with kitchen and ensuite bathrooms, I have stayed in the 1,2, and 3 bedded appartments , all are good and well priced. The hotel is run by Indians for mainly the indian community, but it is clean, and well run. The reception staff are polite, helpfull and efficient. The swimming pool and gym are good and the towels are always ready if you use the pool. Car parking is under the hotel and is very spacious. There is a small shop 100 meters away from the hotel that have any food and essentials you may want, they also deliver. The only drawback is the breakfasts are targeted at the indian cliental and not always to a western taste. In general one of the better reasonably priced hotels in Bur Dubai with a lot of good resturants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Apartments, but stay away from desk clerk 'PARVEZ'”
Reviews.Author: plenty_holidays
Reviews.Content: These apartments were fabulous, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment on arrival by the manager 'Mr John' who was very friendly and helpful during our stay. As per the review below do not bother talking with desk clerk 'Parvez' if you can avoid him then do so.... i believe he mainly works the night shift so is generally there if you are checking in at night or early in the morning. His answer to everything is very unhelpful, always a no, and when finding out about excursions he always quoted 100 dirhams more then other staff, there is free internet available to use for staying guests and he even tried to charge for using that! Apart from him, we had a fabulous holiday, everything about these apartments were lovely, very modern, nice big bedrooms/beds, very clean bathrooms, nice kitchen. They also have a lovely rooftop swimming pool to cool of in the heat and a very new Gym. Apartments are in a good location too about a 10/15 minute walk to al karama/bur juman metro. Very good selection of restaurants nearby. Would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday stay for families, Avoid Nasty desk clerk "Parvez"!”
Reviews.Author: PoshPaws_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of May 2011 for a week. There were 10 of us altogether including a 6mth baby and 5 teenagers from age of 12. After a 7 hour flight from Manchester we arrived here at 6.30am Dubai time, the hotel shuttle bus was already waiting at the airport, (booked in advance) and the driver quickly and helpfully took our baggage and dropped us all at the hotel. Upon arrival at the Reception desk a very unhelpful clerk named "Parvez" informed us that none of the 3 rooms/appartments were available as yet as hotel was fully booked and checkout time was 12 noon.... We asked if we could just at least have one of the rooms to relax and settle into until the other rooms were ready.... i mean what were we supposed to do for the next 5 hours!! This obnoxious man again replied "sorry i cant do anything". We asked him if we would be able to have breakfast as included in our booking, as we were not going to have breakfast on departing hotel due to our flight departure time....Again he replied "No - not possible"..... 10 - 15 mins later the manager a Mr John arrived.. he called us to the desk and apologised not all our rooms were ready as yet, then he advised he would Upgrade us to Appartment Suites if we would prefer and also we could go ahead and have breakfast as dining room was open from 7am... So it appears that "Parvez" was indeed lying to us when he informed Nothing Available! After that encounter everything was perfect.. the suites were very spacious and better than a home away from home.... really clean and great comfy big beds..Housekeeping daily... All the rest of the staff at the hotel really kind and cosiderate and very helpful and willing to help you with anything..... the breakfast selection good - cereals and juices and hot buffet food...toasting facilities...and also the chef will make eggs, omelettes etc and other simple requests.. The pool on the rooftop is very clean and a great view of Dubai skyline.. gym and steam / sauna facilities good. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel,we booked various excursions from the hotel, also each time we asked the prices of anything to "Parvez" he always quoted us 100 dirhams extra than any of his colleagues - so do not ask him! Apart from him - a fab hotel to stay in.... Will definately go back! Good location in Bur Dubai, and the hotel provides a free daily shuttle service to all major attractions

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent hotel...value for money..would like to go back there”
Reviews.Author: nikhar
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing...I was bboked in a single occupancy..bcoz they had problems in their system..the put me in full 1 bedroom suit.. All rooms are well equipped..latest electronics..free internet...wonderful gym and swimming pool...the list is endless I suggest that this a place where you should definitely stay..its not expensisve as well..and you will love it..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DBrown84
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel located a few blocks away from the Al Karama Metro (train) station. Very clean rooms, LCD TV, kitchenette with washer/dryer, Internet is available (wi-fi in lobby only/Ethernet cables in rooms), breakfast buffet available serving local breakfast dishes, pool, spa, and workout facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday Base for Family with young Kids”
Reviews.Author: vicki1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom deluxe apartment; my husband and i had the double bed and the two kids slept in the living room on two pull out type beds. The apartment was well equipped, cleaned daily and well laid out. We enjoyed the pool area. We paid the equivalent of ten Euros for breakfast for the four of us. The variety was pretty good, the quality of the food was ok. We used the metro to get around, which was only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: liesenluc
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in Winchester Grand deluxe hotel in Dubai, but when we arrived at about 4 am, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and so they called a taxi to bring us to the sisterhotel Winchester De luxe where we were given a 2-bedroom appartment in stead of a standard studio. We booked an arrangement with free dinner (asiarooms.com) and we had to go to the Winchester Granddeluxe for our dinners. Both hotels are 5 minuts walking from each other. Our appartment was very big, perhaps too big for 2 persons, but very beautifull and clean. We had a nice big income, big livingroom, a big kitchen, 2 big bedrooms and 2 fully equipped bathrooms, a separate toilet and a terrace with view at the Burj Khalifa. Because our arrival was too late for the first dinner, we were given a free breakfast the first morning. Breakfastbuffet is nothing special, just OK. But we loved the dinnerbuffets in Winchester Granddeluxe, some dishes are too spicy for western taste, but there were always dishes that were excellent. The hotels offer a lot of complimentary things, like free newspapers, free shuttle to some touristplaces, free coffee and tea...and the swimmingpool at the roof is a good place to relax. The hotel is in a good location, not too far from metrostation and busstations and on walking distance from Bur Dubai and Deira. Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rapunzzel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for approx 3 months. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable. I was in a studio appmnt and the kitchenette was well equipped. The grocery stor and metro station is abt 10 min walking distance. Bur Juman, the mall is a 10 ten min walk. There is a little pool on the terrace, which is quite nice. The food is just about ok. I was happy to see a few vegetarian options, especially to suit the Indian palette. On the whole, a decent place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Joyce49
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel after a cruise finished in Dubai. We got to hotel early and they got our room ready in an hour. All the staff at reception were very helpfull. The room was big and had a kitchen with washing machine and tea and coffe but this wasnt replenished till our third day but that was no bother as we just took teabags from the breakfast buffett, Breakfast was OK. We had cereal and toast. There were boild eggs, beans mushrooms and lots of other stuff and they offered us fried eggs after we had finished our breakfast on the first day. Very clean. Free shuttle to about eight different places. Overall if I went to Dubai again I would stay in this hotel. We made use of the very clean roof top pool and enjoyed the view.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: tizibert
Reviews.Content: I've been at Winchester deluxe one week and I had a really pleasant stay. Spacious and confortable studio fully furnished, everyday towels changing. Friendly staff at reception, complimentary shuttle to Jumeira Beach park, metro station, Bur Dubai and Shopping mall. Spectacular view from the roof to downtown, pool with heated water. Sauna, steam and gym on the same floor. 15 minutes walking from Al Karama metro stn. Definitely suggested for short and long stay, leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep31
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. 5 minutes to the Metro station, Bus station and close to the Karama station. Rooms very very spacious, very neat and clean. Suggest to have a policy of having early check in with some discounted rates if rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fantastic pool, great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Edward003
Reviews.Content: This was a great base for a two week break. The location is good and the pool allows you to entertain kids and relax without having to venture outside. Supermarkets are nearby and Carrefour offers cheap ready meals from their Deli. Taxis are readily available. The hotel shuttle goes to the beach but takes nearly an hour. The way back is quicker. A taxi however would only cost about 6 dollars. Rooms are spacious and quiet. The room has a washer/dryer which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A stay better than many hotels.........”
Reviews.Author: Roopks
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 8 nights at the end of NOV and I must say I was impressed by the staff. The appts may not have glass lobby with a turbaned guy opening the doors for you but for the price they charge its worth the additional space you get. We had a 2BR appt and the space was the highlight apart from the flexibility of a full kitchen and washing machine. The staff was very courteous and no request was too much for them. The breakfast was included which a lot of appts do not offer [self catering] The BF may not have everything to our taste but a simple egg and toast was good enough for us. There were some Indian dishes, yoghurt, eggs, mushrooms, beans, muffins etc. Over all we had a very comfortable and peaceful stay and would definitely stay again and recommend this to anyone. The Metro was a good 15 minutes walk which was no bother and you had 24 hours supermarket[spinney's] and Burjuman Mall at walking distance. The hotel also offer a shuttle to the Mall/Beach/Burdubai if anyone wants. Oh yes and the roof top pool offered fantastic views of downtown Dubai especially the Burj Khalifa.

Reviews.Title: “Dont have words its just excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pacehuman
Reviews.Content: Everything in these hotel apartments were top class it was more than a 4 star service and quality , staff was amazing so helpful i have never experienced such a courtious service any were is the world not even in 5 star hotels like Hilton ,Intercontinital and Jumeriah beach hotel ,Dubai. I would strongly recommend stay in this hotel apartments. WINCHESTER DELUXE HOTEL APARTMENT. MY RECOMMADITION IS 6 STARS.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: wings466
Reviews.Content: Be aware, there are two Winchester hotels in Dubai. Their locations on maps are confusing. This one is on Kuwait street. The hotel has a shuttle bus service to take you to Burjurman Center and Jumeirah beach (among other destinations). Walking distance to the nearest metro station Karama is about 500 m. It is easy to get a taxi and they are cheap. The appartment was spacious with a good size kitchen (washing machine), bath room, dining room, living room and bedroom, two TV's. A bit noisy (traffic), but not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Winchester”
Reviews.Author: 1Ktraveller
Reviews.Content: A local friend of mine selected this place since it was end of the year, and I was low on my business travel budget.. For 300dhms a night, I had a nice suite, but was upgraded last minute to a 2 bedroom apartment.. 2nd bedroom and bathroom I did not need nor use.. but the living room and kitchen with full refridgerator came in handy to save the beer and make chai in the morning.. Centrally located place in Mankhool.. Dubai Museum was walking distance.. nice shopping and plenty of restaurants/takeout places nearby.. (Lebanese and Indian/Pakistani) Took taxi to work, which was very convenient. Hotel staff very friendly.. Most of these kind of hotel/apartments in the area serve both business/vacation travellers and also host local families in the so called 'service' apartments concept. So it is very local, very family friendly and works for business travellers too.. you get a sense of the local life and culture.. 10 minute taxi drive to airport... For business travellers many restaurants/bars/nightlife near by. Note - Since this is an apartment, you have to remember to turn on the water heater a few minutes before you hit the shower.. I made the mistake of hitting shower like in a hotel and wondered why my first shower was so cold.. Worked fine the 2nd time once I turned on the heater. Oh.. free internet too.. Overall great place.. Would highly recommend for all.. THere were a few families with kids. Definitely going back to this place, and hopefully with my family next year.. D

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: credgy
Reviews.Content: First and formost I would say that this accomodation gives you excellent value for money, the rooms are well appointed with a large fridge freezer, hob and washing machine. You also get a good TV with some western channels. Its only 5 mins walk to the new metro station which helps your get around the city and they do provide transport to and from a few places. The location was a bit far away from all the action which seems to now have moved around the beach front. The services however was very good, internet access can be got but costs you £30 for a week so a little pricey. There is an excellent supermarket next door selling most things as well. The pool and sun terrace are nice but a little small, a few times I had to sit on a seat as there were not enough sun loungers. Overall a good hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good value and enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: minihilda
Reviews.Content: I visited with my mother for a week and we were very impressed overall. Room/apartment was very clean, spacious, modern and well equippedm (I wouldn't mind living there on a permanent basis!). Bedsheets were changed daily and whole apartment was cleaned, toileteries refilled etc. The staff were very welcoming and accomodating. We arrived at 8am on SAt morning, check in is not usually until 2pm, but they cleaned the first available room for us and we could check in at 9.15am. They also upgraded us free of charge to a 1-bed apt. The breakfast was good and beffet style so you could help yourself. Swimming pool on roof had viw over the city. It was clean and was never too busy so you could always get a chair/sun lounger. Hotel has a free shuttle service which brings you to the metro station, nearby Burjuman shopping centre, Abra station (water taxi to take you to the other side of the creek), Jumeriah beach. It runs fairly regularly. Only slight negative about the hotel was the location. It was a good 15 min walk to the metro station or Burjuman shopping centre. Having said this, there were quite a few hotels around it and the shuttle service helped location-wise. Overall, we had great stay and would highly recommend this hotel for any holiday maker in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy hotel in centre of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: priya1984
Reviews.Content: We went to Dubai for a surprise birthday for my dads 50th. The hotel is quite centrally located to all the nearby attractions which was good. Also next door was a grocery store which was useful. We had originally booked 3 double rooms for 6 of us, but the hotel upgraded us to a 3 bedroom apartment which was huge! They also gave my Dad a lovely chocolate cake for his birthday which was a nice surprise. Each bedroom was a good size and had an en suite and tv in each. We shared a massive living room and kitchen area between us which was beautifully furnished and very clean - cleaning staff also did an excellent job. We had breakfast included which was ok, but lacked organisation and variety. We always found something to eat though. The hotel also offer a good choice of trips eg, dessert safari, dhow cruise, dubai tour etc, however these are also offered at hotel prices and you may find that its cheaper to book via local companies. Overall we found the hotel on par with the 4 star standard and would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, centrally located hotel in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FabioI
Reviews.Content: It's a little bit far from the city centres but it's quite closer to the metro station. Rooms are cleaned very well and reception services are good. I think that breakfast needs to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bkmaa1962
Reviews.Content: Winchester hotel was very prestigious and staff were excellent. There was a hitch when we arrived, the driver took other passangers and left without us, however, we went to Mauritius for holiday and returned back to Winchester upon which we had smooth transfer. We would recommend this hotel as it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartment”
Reviews.Author: jdweber
Reviews.Content: Very polite and professional staff. I had actually booked their sister hotel down the road, but the staff made arrangements for me to stay there, and even upgraded me to a one bedroom. The accommodations are very clean, and spacious. The kitchen is outfitted nicely,and it is offset from the living room, which is nice. Flatscreen televisions in living room, and in bedroom. VERY NICE hotel, and I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby Apartment Block”
Reviews.Author: RuislipHillbilly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at golden sands on 3 previous visits t o Dubai;staying at gs10 and gs3;10 being the best ;on this occasion i opted for the winchester as it was listed as 4th favourite on last minutes website;my whole experience with the winchester was dissapointing from the pool being out of service to being woken at 6.30 with noise which resembled an explosion;i requested a quiet non smoking room;the room was grubby with sockets over the hot plate dirty with food stains ;the whole room reeked of stale smoke and the net curtains were disgusting,other residents complained of being woken by the building work opposite at 6 each morning;internet access was absolute rip off;the only decent thing i can say is the gym was better than goldensands.this hotel/apt block is located in the same area as the goldensands blocks,ie behind the burjman centre,mankool area;i would recommend gs any day before these apts and gs 10 in particular;i will not be staying here again. Visited jumeriah beach park each day,excellent area to relax beds,umbrellas to hire, 5drms entrance to park ,15 per bed ,10 per umbrla,visited burj kalifa 100 drms to viewing terrace ,this is only 420mtrs up the tower ,800+to the top,little bit dissapointing but dubai mall (set off point to the kalifa tower is probably one of the best malls.local exchange rates in dubai were better than any in the uk;in uk got 5.45(tesco ),5.1 at the airport-- heathrow travelex; in dubai 5.75 at various money exchanges in shopping centres changing sterling with no commission.

HotelInfo.Name: Winchester Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Kuwat Street | Al Mankhool, Dubai 29016, United Arab Emirates
